'Cause I don't want nobody to hurt me

I just don't want you to worry

'Cause I don't want nobody to hurt me

title: Wishing Well
description: On “Wishing Well,“ the late rapper Juice WRLD discusses substance abuse and fame, dropping references to his drug of choice,  Percocet . Juice seemingly predicted his own demise on his June 2018  tribute  to  XXXTENTACION  and  Lil Peep , who also died young: On December 8, 2019, Juice WRLD suffered an  accidental overdose at Midway International Airport  in Chicago.

annotations.referent: I cry out for help, do they listen?
annotations.annotation: Juice WRLD is often known for crying out through his music about his struggles with drug addiction – the struggle which ultimately took his life. As he often cried out in his music and to his fans, Jarad battled with prescription drug dependency and depression.

annotations.referent: Sometimes I don’t know how to feel
annotations.annotation: Juice refers to having mixed emotions as he enjoys the satisfaction of taking pills yet knowing that the drugs are slowly taking over him and killing him “softly. “Juice has rapped about having two-sided feelings on his drug addiction multiple times, and expanded on how they help him feel more within the chorus of his March 2019 track, “Feeling," where he raps:I got a feelingPercs help me feel it, I feel it, uhProblems, I numb and conceal themKinda like my feelings, but I still feel them

annotations.referent:
This is the part where I tell you I’m fine, but I’m lying
 I just don’t want you to worry
 This is the part where I take all my feelings and hide ’em
 ’Cause I don’t want nobody to hurt me
annotations.annotation: The pre-chorus notes Juice’s struggles with showing his feelings and insecurities, which is an issue he’s discussed numerous times prior – in both his music and on social media. For example, in his March 2019 hit “Feeling,“ he similarly sang:Problems, I numb and conceal themKinda like my feelings, but I still feel themAnd in October 2018, he tweeted out:Step into my mind and body for 10 seconds I bet you break down in tears, been feeling this way for years

annotations.referent:
You used my past and my memories as a weapon
 On the other line, I talk to addiction, huh
annotations.annotation: While experiencing depression, a person’s negative memories can often feel even worse, as they tend to ruminate over and over again over tense times, making the symptoms worsen. In this hypothetical phone call, Juice speaks to his other main struggle, addiction.

annotations.referent: I’ma be alone until it’s finished
annotations.annotation: In this line, “it’s finished” is regarding the drugs that he consumes, and that the finish will be when the drugs manage to kill him. Earlier in the line, he said “I'ma be alone”.

annotations.referent: Somethin’ feels broke, need to fix it
annotations.annotation: The drugs have destroyed his life yet he isn’t sure that is the issue because he is addicted.
